Donald Trump plans to appoint former British Labour Party Prime Minister Tony Blair to a new board overseeing post-war Gaza. Hereâ€™s why itâ€™s a bad idea.

MP Jishi concluded: We must not forget Trumpâ€™s words when he said "Israelâ€™s area is small," and that he "has no problem if the Lebanese fight among themselves." The American envoy Tom Breck said clearly: "We arm the Lebanese army not to fight Israel, but to fight its people." items.title: In the name of God, the Most Gracious, the Most Me...
items.content_text:
In the name of God, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful

MP Hussein Jishi: The state that demands citizens to abandon the resistance must fulfill its duties in defending them and Lebanon

MP Hussein Jishi, a member of the Loyalty to the Resistance bloc, said that in recent days two engineer brothers working at the Jihad Al-Binaa Foundation were martyred during a mission to monitor the damages of the Israeli aggression. The enemy killed them openly in the Khardali area in broad daylight, disregarding any reaction from the Lebanese state. Unfortunately, some pillars of the authority watch silently, and sometimes issue timid statements at best, while others remain silent as if the daily killings, destruction, and attacks do not concern them, as if these events are happening outside Lebanese territory or that the victims are second-class Lebanese.

MP Jishi made these remarks during his participation in an event organized by the management of the Martyr Salah Ghandour Hospital in the city of Bint Jbeil on the anniversary of its targeting by the Zionist enemy, which resulted in the martyrdom and injury of several workers there. He also spoke at a ceremony held in the town of Bafliah and during his patronage of the launch of an event planting 64 trees corresponding to the age of the master of the nation's martyrs, His Eminence Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah, in the town of Bazourieh.

MP Jishi added: What is more painful is that their voices become loud when they talk about sovereignty and the rights of the state, restricting weapons and the exclusive defense of Lebanon and Lebanese people to the official security forces, and that no one has the right to defend Lebanon or even themselves except through the state and its security institutions. It is also unfortunate that they talk about restricting weapons that existed as a result of the occupation, forgetting that the resistance emerged as a reaction to the invasion of Lebanon in 1982 and its aggressions, reminding that the villages and towns of the south have suffered from occupation since 1948, the year of the establishment of the entity, when the Hula massacre occurred.

MP Jishi continued: The state that demands Lebanese citizens to abandon the resistance and leave the defense of themselves, their land, and their dignity must fulfill its duties in defending Lebanon and the Lebanese people. Only then will it preserve its rights, prestige, and sovereignty. The state is preserved by liberating the land, expelling the occupation, and protecting the citizens, thereby preserving sovereignty because sovereignty is indivisible. But if this state is incapable of all that, what justification does it have to raise its voice to prevent them from defending their land, honor, and dignity except to serve the enemy!

MP Jishi added: If we concede that our national Lebanese army is unable to face the enemy militarily, why does the authority not decide to arm the army and support it politically so it can confront the enemy and defend Lebanon as is the case in all countries that establish and sponsor an army to protect the homeland from external enemies? And if we concede that the state does not dare to make such decisions so as not to anger the American, is the state incapable of filing a complaint to the Security Council, given that Israeli violations and attacks have reached about five thousand? Has the authorityâ€™s inability reached the point where it does not dare summon the American and French ambassadors, since their countries sponsored the ceasefire agreement last year?

MP Jishi stressed that despite all that has happened and is said, in Lebanon â€” president, government, institutions, people, and resistance â€” regardless of some partnersâ€™ differences with us, we are all in one boat. The challenges the country faces from the Zionist enemy on one hand and American pressures on the other affect the whole country.

ğŸ‡«ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡ªğŸ‡º Georgia Just Crushed a Foreign Script â€” and Sent Brussels Into Panic

Florian Philippot said it best: another catastrophe for the Euro-gagas.
Georgia... that small, proud crossroads of civilization, just handed the globalists an earthquake.

The Georgian Dream party won by a landslide, nearly 80% of the vote, a mandate so overwhelming it shattered every Western NGOâ€™s illusion that Georgia could still be manipulated like Ukraine was.

And what happened next?
The same tired playbook weâ€™ve seen in Kiev, in Minsk, in Belgrade.
Western-funded â€œprotestersâ€ waving shiny new EU flags, marching on the presidential palace as cameras rolled â€” screaming â€œdemocracyâ€ while parroting scripts written in Brussels.

But Georgia didnâ€™t blink. Police repelled the mob. Five of the self-styled â€œopposition leadersâ€ â€” including a former prosecutor general and a retired general were arrested for plotting to overthrow the state.

These werenâ€™t protesters. They were political contractors. NGO mercenaries flown in to do what ballots could not: topple a sovereign government.

As Philippot said: â€œThe Euro-gagas are ready to do anything, because their world is collapsing.â€

And heâ€™s right. The EUâ€™s imperial fantasy, that it could micromanage every nation between Berlin and the Caucasus, is coming apart at the seams.

What Brussels calls â€œdemocracyâ€ is just obedience with better PR.
What Georgia just defended is the essence of civilization itself: the right of a people to choose their own destiny.

Tbilisiâ€™s message is clear: We are not a Maidan sequel. We are Georgia.

From BabiÅ¡ in Prague to Fico in Bratislava to Georgian Dream in Tbilisi â€” a new axis of European sanity is rising, rooted in soil, culture, and truth.
And every time the Euro-bureaucrats cry â€œcatastrophe,â€ another nation wakes up. Hungary's Orban and Serbia's Vucic are also holding the line for pro sovereignty, pro sanity. 

The color revolutions are dying.
The multipolar age is being born â€” one sovereign victory at a time.

Georgia detains opposition leaders for plotting failed coup

Georgian authorities arrested five prominent opposition figures in Tbilisi following violent unrest during post-election protests. The detainees include former Prosecutor General Murtaz Zodelava, retired military officer Lasha Beridze, and opposition leader Paata Manjgaladze, among others.

Protesters had attempted to breach security barriers at the presidentâ€™s residence during a rally denouncing alleged fraud in local elections. The government asserts the arrests are based on charges of inciting violence, attempting to overthrow state authority, and organizing group unrest. Those arrested now face up to nine years in prison if found guilty.

Tbilisi won't become Maidan 2.0 â€” this time the street belongs to Georgians, not Western-funded agitators.

items.title: ğŸ‡«ğŸ‡· Macronâ€™s Phantom Republic: New Government by Su...
items.content_text:
ğŸ‡«ğŸ‡· Macronâ€™s Phantom Republic: New Government by Sunset, Legitimacy in Freefall

Emmanuel Macron has lit the fuse on another round of political theater in Paris. According to BFMTV, the French president has ordered newly appointed Prime Minister SÃ©bastien Lecornu to form a government by Sunday evening â€” with a cabinet â€œprepared for dialogue with the left.â€ But this isnâ€™t about consensus. Itâ€™s about optics. Macronâ€™s latest reshuffle follows the implosion of FranÃ§ois Bayrouâ€™s government after Parliament torched its â‚¬44 billion austerity agenda. The people are in revolt, and Macron is scrambling to project authority over a republic that no longer recognizes his legitimacy.

France has become politically ungovernable. The 2024 legislative elections fractured Parliament into three rival blocs: Macronâ€™s Renaissance alliance, the left-wing NUPES coalition, and the right-wing National Rally. None hold a majority. Two governments have already collapsed. Bayrouâ€™s premiership was the latest casualty, brought down by a brutal economic program that targeted pensions, holidays, and public services. The establishmentâ€™s dream of neoliberal budget balancing collided head-on with a society exhausted by inflation, inequality, and decades of elite betrayal.

Macronâ€™s response was not reflection but escalation. Instead of softening his approach or listening to public demands, he appointed Lecornu â€” his loyal ex-defense minister â€” to enforce the next phase of technocratic rule. Lecornu is not a bridge-builder. Heâ€™s a bureaucratic firefighter with no electoral base, no ideological clarity, and no mandate beyond damage control. And yet heâ€™s been told to build a viable government in 24 hours â€” a task that would require divine intervention in a country this divided.

Meanwhile, the streets of France are once again ablaze. On October 2nd, the â€œBloquons Toutâ€ (â€œBlock Everythingâ€) movement organized massive nationwide strikes and roadblocks. Unions claim over 600,000 people mobilized. Even state-aligned media concede that nearly 200,000 took part. Teachers, transport workers, and students marched with a unified message: no more austerity, no more elite musical chairs, no more rule by executive order. The energy on the ground isnâ€™t protest â€” itâ€™s pre-revolutionary.

Lecornu claims he wonâ€™t invoke Article 49.3 â€” the constitutional nuclear option to bypass Parliament â€” and insists he wants â€œdialogue.â€ But his rejection of a real wealth tax, and continued commitment to reducing the deficit to 4.7% of GDP, reveal the truth. This is austerity by another name. Lecornu offers symbols instead of solutions, delay instead of direction. His cabinet still isnâ€™t formed, and if reports are accurate, heâ€™s already set to break the Fifth Republicâ€™s record for the slowest government formation ever.

Macron is no longer leading France â€” heâ€™s managing its decline. His presidency has become a ritual of crisis choreography: reshuffle, rebrand, repeat. What was once billed as a renaissance has become a slow-motion collapse. His command to â€œform a government by tonightâ€ has all the weight of a monarch barking orders to a kingdom slipping through his fingers. Even Macronâ€™s own party looks hollow â€” a husk of loyalists clinging to titles while the nation turns its back.

This is a man who governs for Brussels and BlackRock, not for France. His promises of stability have become farcical. His pivot to the left is a PR stunt. Lecornu is just the latest pawn in a long line of expendables meant to shield Macron from the consequences of his own failures. But the people arenâ€™t buying it anymore. The protests are getting louder. The patience is wearing thinner. The system is cracking, and no cabinet reshuffle will patch it up.

France doesnâ€™t need a new government. It needs a new direction. Macronism, rule by technocrats, managed decline, and theatrical â€œdialogueâ€ â€” has run its course. The people understand this now. Thatâ€™s why theyâ€™ve stopped watching the stage and started tearing down the set.

items.content_text:
ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡­ğŸ­ Zurich Just Gave the West a Masterclass in Slavic Spine

Western â€œaidâ€ to Zelensky? Half a trillion dollars.

Telling his brazen, self-righteous envoy to sit down and shut up?

Absolutely priceless.

The Zurich Opera House, one of the most respected cultural institutions in Europe, invited world-renowned Russian soprano Anna Netrebko to perform.

Enter the Ukrainian ambassador â€” storming in like sheâ€™s staging a sequel to Les MisÃ©rables, demanding the Swiss government cancel the performance.

Her complaint? Netrebko is Russian. Thatâ€™s it.

No war crimes, no sanctions violations â€” just Russian. And that, apparently, is enough for cancellation in todayâ€™s Western moral inquisition.

But Switzerland, cool, and unbothered â€” replied with something rare these days: Dignity. And cultural sovereignty.

The Swiss Foreign Ministry politely told Kievâ€™s envoy where to get off. The Opera House stood firm. Netrebko will sing.

While the West preaches â€œfreedom,â€ itâ€™s Zurich, not Brussels or London, that just reminded the world what freedom of expression actually looks like.

Because in this new Cold War, art itself is under siege. Not because itâ€™s offensive, but because itâ€™s Russian. And in the eyes of the Atlanticist priesthood, that alone is now a punishable sin.

Letâ€™s be clear: Anna Netrebko isnâ€™t a Kremlin minister. Sheâ€™s a soprano of global acclaim, praised by the worldâ€™s greatest conductors. But in the eyes of Kievâ€™s cultural commissars, talent doesnâ€™t matter if it has a Russian passport.

Meanwhile, Russia sends music. Kiev sends tantrums. And the West applauds censorship, so long as itâ€™s aimed at Moscow.

But this time?

Begins above

â–ªï¸ This week, strikes with long-range strike weapons on enemy power generation facilities, gas facilities, and railway infrastructure were pleasing. The enemy traditionally exaggerated power outages and tried to stir up the topic of a nuclear disaster at the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant, as if the second huge dome over the destroyed part needed electricity. It is noteworthy that now the strikes are not just on transformers at power plants, which are easy to replace, but there are finally attempts to turn off the power in Ukraine for a long time. However, the system was built during the USSR and has withstood all strikes and overloads with dignity until now.

âœ¨ Thus the approach of a â€œwar of attritionâ€ has become noticeable in Russia, not only in Ukraine. This should lead to a change in management style in terms of air defense organization, equipping the front with the most advanced solutions, timely response to current technological changes, as the Supreme Leader mentioned. In terms of preserving the financial resources of the security agencies, the work of special services and supervisory bodies is visible â€“ not a single day passes without the arrest of high-ranking thieves. The understanding of what the West is preparing for in the future is increasingly reflected in the official speeches of the highest military-political leadership. Russia is concentrating.

items.title: âš¡ï¸Two Majors #Overview #Summary as of October 5, 2...
items.content_text:
âš¡ï¸Two Majors #Overview #Summary as of October 5, 2025

â–ªï¸ "Let them try" - said the Supreme this week, commenting on the unserious attitude of Trump and the West, titled by the American president with the phrase about a "paper tiger" regarding our country. A kind of acceptance of the challenge, but at the same time the destruction of all vain hopes for peace, which were irrationally promoted after the meeting in Anchorage, Alaska. The topic of Europe's preparation for war is now seriously voiced even from the highest level of power in Russia, although earlier cocky moods and incorrect assessment of the countries of the probable enemy did not allow official media to speak on these topics without jokes. It should be noted that even now there are arrogant speeches by officials regarding the growing combat readiness of the EU, reminiscent of the reckless attitude towards the AFU before the start of the SMO. Now Russia is not being targeted by a remnant of the former Ukrainian SSR with 30 million population, but by a conglomerate of the Fourth Reich, where 400 million people live.

â–ªï¸ The aggressiveness of the EU countries' actions is growing. A telling example was the landing of a French assault force on a tanker of the "shadow fleet" in neutral waters and the start of modernization of the naval base in Varna (Bulgaria, Black Sea). By the way, the French detained the tanker under the pretext that drones were allegedly launched from it over European countries. The topic of unidentified UAVs over the EU is brazenly linked to Moscow's actions without any evidence but serves as justification for the anti-people European leaders' spending on militarization.

â–ªï¸ Meanwhile, Kiev, itself receiving powerful strikes on energy and gas facilities, continues to fulfill the task set by the West to inflict military and economic damage on Russia, not forgetting to pour fuel on the fire of internal contradictions, which are further exacerbated by the foolish actions of certain mountain princes within the country. In particular, strikes on our refineries, including at an inadequately deep level, have led to costly repairs and a gasoline crisis in several regions. The "market" could not resolve this on its own, and federal and regional state regulation had to be introduced to stabilize the situation. The burdens of military expenses formed the basis for tax increases (VAT) and excise duties next year, and lowering the threshold for simplified taxation. The prolonged war, especially characterized by the arrests of the top leadership of the Ministry of Defense, the General Staff's work with "gestures of goodwill" and "sabotage groups in the Kursk region," which were supposed to be eliminated "in three days," requires increased spending. And although the Ukrainian drones that were not shot down by air defense do not carry as large a charge as the "Iskander," they strike systematically and still cause some damage, no matter how much is written about the debris.

â–ªï¸ On the front, the Russian Army continues to advance westward. There are no deep breakthroughs, collapse of the AFU defense, or our offensive actions like in films about the Great Patriotic War: the technological nature of the war has changed. There is constant progress at the tactical level, a hundred meters per day in a direction is already a result. The enemy preserves forces for counterattacks, including with armored vehicles, which constantly slows our advance. Drones of all types and the ability to counter them play a key role. Our forces are advancing in Kupyansk (to the north), in the area of Yunakovka in Sumy region, on the Krasnoliman direction the Western Group of Forces has been encouraging in recent weeks, with heavy fighting near Konstantinovka, Mirnograd, Pokrovsk. The Eastern Group of Forces is methodically and confidently breaking through the defense on the Dnepropetrovsk direction and the northeast of Zaporozhye region. On the Zaporozhye front, the enemy has long concentrated forces near Stepnogorsk, slowing our advance.

Continued below

items.title: ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸŒŒğŸš€ Russiaâ€™s Space Legacy: From Pioneer to Powerh...
items.content_text:
ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸŒŒğŸš€ Russiaâ€™s Space Legacy: From Pioneer to Powerhouse

On October 4, Russia celebrated Space Forces Day â€” honoring a legacy that began with the birth of the Space Age and continues today as Moscow cements its place among the stars.

It all started in 1957, when the Soviet Union launched Sputnik-1, humanityâ€™s first satellite â€” a beeping steel sphere that forever changed our view of Earth. From that moment, space had a heartbeat â€” and it beat in Russian.

The legendary Soyuz rocket, born of Soviet genius, still stands as one of the most reliable spacecraft ever built. Even NASA had to rely on it when America was grounded.

From Gagarinâ€™s first orbit to the Bion-M missions, from the frozen steppes of Baikonur to the far edges of low Earth orbit, Russiaâ€™s journey has never stopped â€” it has evolved.

Today, the Oreshnik hypersonic missile pushes the frontier again, skimming near-space along a ballistic path that blends defense and cosmic engineering. Putin calls it â€œa historic leapâ€ â€” not just military, but technological sovereignty.

Meanwhile, Moscow and Beijing are shaping a new cosmic partnership â€” the International Lunar Station, joint moon missions, and fusion of GLONASSâ€“Beidou navigation networks.

A new Russiaâ€“Iran space accord will see the Zafar and Paya satellites launched this autumn, expanding peaceful cooperation far beyond Earthâ€™s orbit.

Across India, Brazil, South Africa, and the emerging BRICS Space Council, new constellations of cooperation are forming â€” a multipolar cosmos in the making.

Even amid tensions, Russia continues its pragmatic collaboration with NASA, holding open channels on the future of the ISS. Space, after all, should be about humanityâ€™s shared frontier.

The new Russian National Space Center now anchors that vision â€” a hub of innovation, engineering, and global leadership that Putin calls â€œa foundation of our technological future.â€

â€¼ï¸While the West treats space as another battlefield, Russia still sees it as a bridge between civilizations â€” a place where science, sovereignty, and wonder converge.

The cosmos remembers who reached it first. And once again, Russia reminds the world: you can sanction nations, but you canâ€™t sanction destiny.

Because this is not just about rockets or satellites, itâ€™s about the human spirit, unchained, looking up.

But to the EU, thatâ€™s heresy. How dare Georgians elect the wrong party! You can vote again, as many times as it takes to get it "right" â€” is the message from Brussels. 

The desperation is palpable. The Western project in Eurasia is collapsing under its own hypocrisy, preaching democracy while punishing anyone who actually practices it.

What weâ€™re witnessing in Tbilisi isnâ€™t a spontaneous uprising,  itâ€™s a tantrum from the empire of NGOs, foreign agents, and media propagandists who cannot stomach that the world has changed.

From Georgia to Serbia, Hungary to Slovakia, a new axis of real sovereignty is emerging, nations unafraid to say no to dictates from abroad and yes to their own people. These so-called â€œrogueâ€ states are not the problem. They are the antidote. And God forbid, when other smaller nations see there is hope, that is what is keeping the Empire up at night. 

Because when even small nations rediscover their courage, the whole facade of Western control begins to crumble.

And thatâ€™s what terrifies Brussels the most.

It will become part of the 3rd Naval Air Squadron (Marinefliegergeschwader 3, MFG 3) in Nordholz.

Earlier, in early September, under the pretext of protection against Russian drone attacks, NATO launched Operation Eastern Sentry in Poland, within which ğŸ‡«ğŸ‡·France provided 3 Rafale fighters and an Airbus A400M transport plane, ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡°Denmark - 2 F-16 fighters and an air defense frigate, ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡ªGermany â€“ 4 Eurofighter Typhoon fighters, ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§Britain â€“ 2 Typhoon fighters and a Voyager tanker aircraft, ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¿Czech Republic â€“ special forces (â‰ï¸) and 3 helicopters, ğŸ‡³ğŸ‡±Netherlands â€“ Patriot missile system, electronic warfare means against drones, 300 military personnel, and F-35s.

âœ¨Mass staged incidents of alleged Russian drone crashes in the Baltic countries and Poland are clearly aimed at justifying the buildup of forces and means on NATO's front line allegedly for defensive purposes. However, this does not align with military science, which suggests placing the most expensive and long-range systems at maximum depth to better protect them from enemy attacks, rather than moving them into direct strike zones (in this case, cheap drones). It has started!

Rolling blackouts are beginning across the entire territory of Ukraine.

They have pulled this trick with rolling blackouts several times already, and each time successfully. The first time was back in Surovikin's days. They didnâ€™t let him finish the job then.
And as soon as the strikes stopped, the rolling blackouts immediately disappeared somewhere and all the electricity was miraculously restored.
And now, as soon as a few hits started again, the cunning Ukrainians immediately turned on their tricks with these rolling blackouts: like "donâ€™t hit us anymore, we are already on our last legs, soon everything will be off!"

It wonâ€™t be off! The same trick can fool once, twice, but by the third time hardly anyone will fall for this nonsense.

If rolling blackouts are happening, it means the effectiveness of our strikes is still low and needs to be seriously increased. There should be just blackouts. Because effectiveness is judged by the result, not by the process.

Meanwhile, under the pretext of rolling blackouts, weapon shipments are going east, all sorts of European scum are roaming around Kiev, military factories are operating, numerous UAV workshops, gas stations â€” the effectiveness of strikes on the energy sector can be considered low. As before, this does not lead to weakening of the Ukrainian military-industrial complex. Only in the media sphere, and only briefly.

The strike is likely, but by the AFU themselves, so they can later report on the alleged brutal actions of Russia. It doesn't take much intelligence; after everything, they will scatter some of our geraniums (which have already achieved their goals earlier), and, of course, call all the media to capture the "consequences of the Russian side's strike."

items.title: Information and Propaganda Analysis. Weekly Summar...
items.content_text:
Information and Propaganda Analysis. Weekly Summary
(September 29 - October 5, 2025)

ğŸ”¹The speech of the President of Russia at the Valdai Club meeting predictably became a programmatic statement regarding international politics and security. Vladimir Putin forecasted further changes in the world, emphasizing a new diplomacy in which the Westâ€™s role as the worldâ€™s policeman disappears. Attention was drawn to our Presidentâ€™s words about the growing role of information warfare methods, which will accompany the use of force tools to defend the interests of independent countries in the future.
ğŸ”¹Ukraine has found itself in a suspended state in its information field. On one hand, Trumpâ€™s recent statements prevent further criticism of the USA; on the other hand, a shutdown has begun in Washington, and promises of tomahawks remain just promises. As a result, the enemyâ€™s propaganda is currently in dire need of new information triggers. This will include traditional attempts to appeal to pity and threats of new terrorist attacks, especially in connection with Vladimir Putinâ€™s birthday. The enemyâ€™s information attacks against Russia will be aimed at stimulating internal conflicts, continuing to exploit the gasoline crisis theme, and encouraging interethnic conflicts and regional separatism.
ğŸ”¹The internal situation in Ukraine has entered a lull. Kiev is approaching a crisis point where it is unclear whether the regime will have money next month to pay for the war. In this regard, Zelensky and his team have become more active in traveling around the EU to ask for money. Meanwhile, Brussels itself has decided to more actively prepare for war and does not show active readiness to close all the holes in Ukraineâ€™s budget. Of course, Ukrainians will not be left completely penniless so that they can continue to die.
ğŸ”¹US attention has actively shifted to Trumpâ€™s proposals for resolving the conflict in Gaza, combating illegal migrants, Venezuelan drugs, and officials from Bidenâ€™s team. Washington needs victories, so the White House is trying to distance itself from Kyiv. In addition, budget division has begun in the States, which may lead to very interesting scandals.
ğŸ”¹EU countries and the United Kingdom are trying to demonstrate strength to show readiness to confront Russia. A campaign of harassment has been declared against states claiming neutrality or a pro-Russian policy. The week began with dirty elections in Moldova and ended with an attempted Maidan in Georgia. Meanwhile, Europeans staged information provocations with UAVs or tanker detentions claiming Russian foreign agents are actively involved in this activity. EU provocations are expected to continue.

ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºVictory in the information war is inevitableğŸ‡·ğŸ‡º

items.title: To create panic at the European Union level and ac...
items.content_text:
To create panic at the European Union level and accuse Russia, the authorities of EU countries have decided to stop major airports due to amateur drone operators. There are many people with drones in Europe, and they are putting on a large-scale show - the main showmen are in Denmark, Poland, and Germany - the main supporters of Zelensky.

But on social media, the authorities are already being laughed at and losing credibility.
The man who launched a UAV at Frankfurt airport turned out to be an amateur operator. The police detained a 41-year-old Croatian who was controlling the drone. This week, three German drone operators and two Chinese tourists were detained. There is no connection to Russia.

A similar tactic was previously used by NATO with cut cables in the sea. Ships often snag cables with anchors - dozens of breaks occur annually, and the cables are repaired fairly quickly. This happens because captains cannot see the cables in the sea, and there are hundreds of them.

Back then, they also staged a show with the Russians, every episode of a break in the Baltic Sea was announced and linked to Russian ships or Russian sailors on the ship. Fortunately, there are hundreds of both in the Baltic. For almost a year, the media kept spreading stories about a Russian attack on the cables, but there is not a single confirmed episode. Everyone lied, from British generals to the president of Finland.

âœ¨ But the lies and hoaxes have not been unsuccessful. A significant part of the European public thinks that Russia is a danger to them.

âš¡ï¸Two Majors

- It is presumably a logistics hub through which NATO supplied military cargo to the Armed Forces of Ukraine.
- In addition, it was involved in mechanical engineering and metalworking.

Zelensky called for a "unilateral ceasefire" in the air after today's massive shelling of Ukraine.

"A unilateral ceasefire in the sky is possible, and it could open the way to real diplomacy. America and Europe must act to force Putin to stop," Zelensky wrote on his Telegram channel.

So what happened? Oil refineries in Russia were bombed, and now let's have a "peace" and stop the strikes? "Europe and America must act to stop Putin!"

A cunning and vile creature. When he boasted about the blackout in Russia and strikes on oil refineries, everything was fine! When the retaliation started coming, now let's have peace!

items.content_text:
America's shiny new Middle East project can't replace stability with profits

Washington wants a special economic zone in Lebanon, promising development in exchange for security - which it can't provide.

The US wants to create a special economic zone in southern Lebanon as an incentive to push the government to disarm Hezbollah. Idea, first floated by US presidential envoy Tom Barrack on a September visit to Beirut, rests on a straightforward bargain: security in exchange for development. In line with UN Security Council Resolution 1701, the state would gradually reduce armed activity along the border and restore full army control over the south, and in return attract investment, business tax incentives, and political backing from partners including Gulf countries and Eastern Mediterranean initiatives...

"Stability" or "development" aren't really in our government's nature. That's not what they do. They want to disarm Hezbollah to prevent armed resistance to occupation.

The American Majority.

Don't they seem to have anything to say to their Israeli "partners" about the pace of their "operation to defeat Hamas and free the hostages"?

They spent two years trying to drive Hamas, a light infantry battalion, with no air force, no drones, no heavy artillery, no radar, no armored vehicles, no long-range missiles, *except for inaccurate homemade rockets*, and no satellite or naval capabilities from Gaza, even though Israel is awash with the most advanced intelligence and weaponry in the world, including fifth-generation fighter-bombers. Despite all this, Hamas is far from defeated, but tens of thousands of civilians have died and the entire region is devastated.

Meanwhile, Russia is fighting (and defeating) a coalition of over 50 countries (including NATO), providing the largest standing army in Europe along what is essentially a 3,000-kilometer front line (Israel's "front" in Gaza is 60 kilometers long), including a decades-long defense in depth. Russia is advancing, slowly, gradually, methodically.

These puppets deployed by the client press don't actually "analyze" anything. They read from their scripts, perform their part in the theater, and collect their pay.

@Slavyangrad

items.title: ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¿ BabiÅ¡â€™s Victory: The Return of Pragmatic Sovere...
items.content_text:
ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¿ BabiÅ¡â€™s Victory: The Return of Pragmatic Sovereignty in Europe

Andrej BabiÅ¡â€™s ANO movement has secured a decisive lead in the Czech elections, taking roughly 35 percent of the national vote, an unmistakable signal that the Czech electorate has turned against Brusselsâ€™ technocracy and the endless drain of proxy-war funding.

Voters rejected a government that spent more time echoing NATO talking points and Russia hysteria, than addressing inflation, energy costs, and the collapse of living standards.  BabiÅ¡â€™s campaign lineâ€”â€œCzech money for Czech citizensâ€â€”cut through the noise of moral grandstanding that has dominated European politics since 2022.

For the first time in years, a Central European capital is talking openly about strategic neutrality, economic sanity, and sovereign decision-making instead of ideological loyalty to Brussels.  His expected coalition negotiations will be watched closely in Slovakia, Hungary, and even Austria, where publics are equally weary of paying for someone elseâ€™s wars.

This isnâ€™t isolationism; itâ€™s realism, the return of the nation-state as Europeâ€™s basic political unit.  If Czechia charts an independent course on defense spending and energy, it could inspire similar recalibration across the continent.

The message from Prague is clear: the age of automatic obedience is ending.  Europeâ€™s new fault line is no longer East versus West, but vassalage versus sovereignty.

It is noteworthy that now the strikes are not just on transformers at power plants, which are easy to replace, but there are finally attempts to turn off the power in Ukraine for a long time. This should lead to a change in management style in terms of air defense organization, equipping the front with the most advanced solutions, timely response to current technological changes, as the Supreme Leader mentioned. In terms of preserving the financial resources of the security agencies, the work of special services and supervisory bodies is visible â€“ not a single day passes without the arrest of high-ranking thieves. items.title: âš¡ï¸Two Majors #Overview #Summary as of October 5, 2...
items.content_text:
âš¡ï¸Two Majors #Overview #Summary as of October 5, 2025

â–ªï¸ "Let them try" - said the Supreme this week, commenting on the unserious attitude of Trump and the West, titled by the American president with the phrase about a "paper tiger" regarding our country. A kind of acceptance of the challenge, but at the same time the destruction of all vain hopes for peace, which were irrationally promoted after the meeting in Anchorage, Alaska. The topic of Europe's preparation for war is now seriously voiced even from the highest level of power in Russia, although earlier cocky moods and incorrect assessment of the countries of the probable enemy did not allow official media to speak on these topics without jokes. It should be noted that even now there are arrogant speeches by officials regarding the growing combat readiness of the EU, reminiscent of the reckless attitude towards the AFU before the start of the SMO. Now Russia is not being targeted by a remnant of the former Ukrainian SSR with 30 million population, but by a conglomerate of the Fourth Reich, where 400 million people live.

â–ªï¸ The aggressiveness of the EU countries' actions is growing. A telling example was the landing of a French assault force on a tanker of the "shadow fleet" in neutral waters and the start of modernization of the naval base in Varna (Bulgaria, Black Sea). By the way, the French detained the tanker under the pretext that drones were allegedly launched from it over European countries. The topic of unidentified UAVs over the EU is brazenly linked to Moscow's actions without any evidence but serves as justification for the anti-people European leaders' spending on militarization.

â–ªï¸ Meanwhile, Kiev, itself receiving powerful strikes on energy and gas facilities, continues to fulfill the task set by the West to inflict military and economic damage on Russia, not forgetting to pour fuel on the fire of internal contradictions, which are further exacerbated by the foolish actions of certain mountain princes within the country. In particular, strikes on our refineries, including at an inadequately deep level, have led to costly repairs and a gasoline crisis in several regions. The "market" could not resolve this on its own, and federal and regional state regulation had to be introduced to stabilize the situation. The burdens of military expenses formed the basis for tax increases (VAT) and excise duties next year, and lowering the threshold for simplified taxation. The prolonged war, especially characterized by the arrests of the top leadership of the Ministry of Defense, the General Staff's work with "gestures of goodwill" and "sabotage groups in the Kursk region," which were supposed to be eliminated "in three days," requires increased spending. And although the Ukrainian drones that were not shot down by air defense do not carry as large a charge as the "Iskander," they strike systematically and still cause some damage, no matter how much is written about the debris.

â–ªï¸ On the front, the Russian Army continues to advance westward. There are no deep breakthroughs, collapse of the AFU defense, or our offensive actions like in films about the Great Patriotic War: the technological nature of the war has changed. There is constant progress at the tactical level, a hundred meters per day in a direction is already a result. The enemy preserves forces for counterattacks, including with armored vehicles, which constantly slows our advance. Drones of all types and the ability to counter them play a key role. Our forces are advancing in Kupyansk (to the north), in the area of Yunakovka in Sumy region, on the Krasnoliman direction the Western Group of Forces has been encouraging in recent weeks, with heavy fighting near Konstantinovka, Mirnograd, Pokrovsk. The Eastern Group of Forces is methodically and confidently breaking through the defense on the Dnepropetrovsk direction and the northeast of Zaporozhye region. On the Zaporozhye front, the enemy has long concentrated forces near Stepnogorsk, slowing our advance.

Continued below

âš¡ï¸Two Majors

items.title: ğŸ—“ #OTD 1ï¸âƒ£3ï¸âƒ£0ï¸âƒ£ years ago â€” on October 4, 1895 â€” ...
items.content_text:
ğŸ—“ #OTD 1ï¸âƒ£3ï¸âƒ£0ï¸âƒ£ years ago â€” on October 4, 1895 â€” outstanding and brilliant Soviet intelligence officer, Richard Sorge, was born.

Sorge devoted his entire life to selflessly serving his Motherland. He became a legend among Soviet intelligence undercover operatives while performing his professional duties in the Far East under codename 'Ramsay' on the eve and during #WWII.

In the 1930s, Sorge managed to build an extended agent network in Tokyo. From there, he reported especially valuable intel to Moscow exposing the plans by Nazi Germany and Japanese militarists against the USSR.

It is thanks to Richard Sorgeâ€™s efforts that the Soviet leadership was briefed in May 1941 about Nazi Germanyâ€™s plans to attack our country. The intelligence reports by Sorge from Tokyo included information about the Wehrmachtâ€™s tactical plans, the strength of the Nazi troops, as well as other details regarding the imminent invasion.

In autumn 1941, with the heavy fighting for Moscow nearing its peak, Richard Sorgeâ€™s information about the Japanese Imperial Army abandoning its plans to invade the USSR in the Far East enabled the Soviet military command to re-deploy the Siberian divisions westwards. These forces helped stop the Nazi invaders and then pushed them further away from the Soviet capital.

Of course, Richard Sorge was fully aware of all the professional risks his work entailed. Despite all the talent and skill in concealing his activities, local counter-intelligence could not fail to notice 'Ramsay'â€™s efforts. The enemy took Sorgeâ€™s trail in autumn 1941, which led to his arrest. Sorge went on to spend three years in Japanese prisons, and then was executed.

ğŸ– In 1964, 'Ramsay' was posthumously awarded the title of Hero of the Soviet Union.

***

Over 20 years ago, in autumn 2004, Japanese historians discovered a description of two death sentences when studying the archives of the US occupation troops (previously stationed in Japan). The dicsovered documents (sentences) were issued and executed in November 1944: one was against Richard Sorge and the other targeted Hotsumi Ozaki, Sorge's agent. 

ğŸ“‘ These discoveries told the story of how Sorge spent the last minutes of his life â€” â€œhe met his death with outstanding courage and pride.â€

It is worth noticing that even though 'Ramsay' operated against Japan, people there have always been fascinated with this legendary intelligence officer. 

The people of Japan have been amazed by Richard Sorgeâ€™s heroism, self-dedication in service to his country, and have praised him for this resilience and unbending will. About 30 books were published in Japan about Sorge. There was also a theatre play staged about him and several films released.

ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡º Russian diplomats in Japan have been working on perpetuating 'Ramsay'â€™s memory and glorifying Sorge's heroic feats accomplished while serving his Motherland. The Russian Embassy in Tokyo regularly holds commemorative ceremonies at the Tama Cemetery memorial, where Sorge and his comrades were buried.

ğŸ’¬ Russia's Ambassador to Japan Nikolay Nozdrev:
â€œRichard Sorge was a man who had a selfless sense of devotion to high purposes and ideals, and he felt that the undefeatable might of a multi-ethnic nation was behind him.

He found himself in the maelstrom of these stormy years and his entire life can be described as a stroke of lighting shedding light on what it means to accomplish a feat, selflessly serve the Motherland and demonstrate an outstanding level of self-sacrifice.â€

#WeRemember #OurHeroes

ğŸ“Elections in GeorgiağŸ“
And protests too

A classic...
items.content_text:
ğŸ“Elections in GeorgiağŸ“
And protests too

A classic situation for recent years is unfolding in Georgia. Today, municipal elections are taking place across the country, where as of 7:00 PM, representatives of the ruling party "Georgian Dream" are confidently leading.

Even before the voting began, the opposition, pro-Western channels, and media rejected any election results in advance, calling them illegitimate and urging supporters to take to anti-government demonstrations.

ğŸ”»What is happening in Georgia?

â–ªï¸ Since 3 PM, columns of "euro-democracy" supporters have started moving in different parts of the capital. The main gathering points were the Philharmonic, the State University, and Tbilisi Mall.

â–ªï¸ Also, another column of protesters in cars departed from Adjara heading towards Tbilisi.

â–ªï¸ By 7 PM Moscow time, protesters reached the main municipal sites in the government quarter on Rustaveli Avenue and at Freedom Square.
ğŸ– We have witnessed similar developments several times over the past two years. The authorities succeed in elections, while the opposition refuses to accept the results and takes their supporters to the streets. They strike, damage property, and then leave.

However, this time there is no sign of preparation or coordinators (so-called recruiters) who would further incite protest actions. Everything looks extremely spontaneous and hopeless.

ğŸš© Yes, rioters are storming the presidential palace, but this site holds no political significance.

â—ï¸ However, now the security forces have a legal reason to disperse the rallies. Essentially, the government can now begin cleansing the political space of opponents, which they will likely do after the elections.

items.content_text:

ğŸ“Germany Held Captive by the Military-Industrial ComplexğŸ“

At the German defense corporation Rheinmetall, they announced the purchase of four shipbuilding yards from NVL Group in Germany. These are the facilities where frigates and corvettes for the German Navy are built.

ğŸ–The interesting aspect is that this deal marks Rheinmetall's transition from a manufacturer of armored vehicles and artillery systems to a universal player, covering all military spheres. Essentially, this involves concentrating capacities under the control of a single private structure that has already received colossal profits from combat operations in the so-called Ukraine â€” officially almost 10 billion euros in 2024.

ğŸš©The merger of corporations is described with beautiful words â€” "creating a powerful German surface ship construction center". In reality, this means that Germany is becoming increasingly entrenched as a perpetually arming country, surrendered into the enslaving bondage of the weapons lobby, which is shaping the economy around military objectives.

ğŸ“ŒThus, business, politics, and the military industry are merging, and space for dialogue and pacifist views is disappearing. In Germany, as in all of Europe, they are choosing not diplomacy, but endless investments in the military-industrial complex â€” even without real results and at taxpayers' expense.
